item.title: Congratulating the Miami Heat for winning the 2006 NBA Championship.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6321-6322; text as passed Senate: CR S6322; text of measure as introduced: CR S6288-6289)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6321-6322; text as passed Senate: CR S6322; text of measure as introduced: CR S6288-6289)

summary.text: Congratulates the Miami Heat for its victory in the 2006 National Basketball Association (NBA) Championship.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Congratulates the Miami Heat for its victory in the 2006 National Basketball Association (NBA) Championship.

bill.title: A resolution congratulating the Miami Heat for winning the National Basketball Association Championship.

item.title: A resolution congratulating the Miami Heat for winning the National Basketball Association Championship.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
